concept.title: Types of testing
concept.shortdesc: Overview of tests covered in this guide.

conbody.note: These instructions have been tested on macOS. Other operating systems may not be fully supported.

section.title: Authentication
section.p: Verify that valid API keys are accepted and invalid keys are rejected.

section.title: Creating a Payment Intent
section.p: A Payment Intent is the core object for managing the complete payment process in Stripe. Each Payment Intent represents a single payment attempt and automatically handles authentication requirements and payment method variations.

section.title: Retrieving a Payment Intent
section.p: Once a Payment Intent is created, Stripe assigns it an ID. You can test that you can perform a GET request to retrieve the ID.

section.title: Customers
section.p: A Customer object is a representation of a customer in your Stripe account. You can store multiple payment methods, shipping addresses, and more on the Customer object, and all fields are optional.

section.title: Currency Handling
section.p: Stripe uses ISO currency codes and amounts specified in the smallest currency unit, for example, cents for usd.
